intro: Epidendrum fragrans var. janeirense, commonly known as the fragrant epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, showy inflorescences that bear clusters of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a rosette pattern. This variety is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its elegant appearance and subtle, sweet fragrance.
